pageContext.description: A series of eleven from the same mould, deep stop with horseshoe hollowing  below straight sides. No loop. Two show blow holes in stopridge.
pageContext.other: Weights for palstaves listed as: 457 gms; 448 gms; 450 gms; 450 gms; 455 gms; 445 gms; 455 gms; 457 gms; 455 gms; 450 gms; 453 gms
pageContext.collection: British Museum,1927.1-7.1,Purchased from Mr. Signey J. Browning, Corwe Gates, near Ringwood, Hampshire through the Forestry Commissioners 22 Grosvenor Gardens, London, SW1
pageContext.site: England, hampshire,burley,all found together in a rabbit burrow in broad oak pit near burley, new forest, hampshire. (the pit is shown on the ordnance map close to the road between burley and wilverley port.)
